title: Who is more powerful between USA and USSR.? - Quora
tags: Russia and the United States of America

response.answer_text: It depends on when you compare them. 1945–1955 Economy (always GDP PPP): USA Military: USA Industrial power: USA Life quality: USA Technology: USA The USSR was recovering from ww2, and Stalin’s 5 year plans after the war didn’t improve much apart from rebuilding the country. 1955–1965 Economy: USA Military power: USSR Industrial power: USSR Life Quality: USSR Technology: USSR The USSR (with the very good Kruschev’s economic policies) came dangerously close to surpass American GDP (Russia, which represents about 45% of the Union’s population and 50% of the PPP GDP reached nearly half of the US GDP). The quality of life in that time was probably better in the USSR, no racism, very good public transport compensated the lack of cars, healthcare that the US could only dream in the 60s and much more equality. The USSR economy had an higher percentage of industry than the US, so with economies nearly equal but with the USSR’s GDP coming mostly from industry, industrial power is in USSR favour. Military wise, although other Nato members balanced things a bit, the USSR enjoyed way greater numbers and and higher quality of the equipment. Soviets main fighters (the mig21) was better than his US counterpart (the F4 phantom), Soviet tanks were better and the Soviet soldiers was better equipped (the Americans Still didn’t have a good main infantry weapon like the Ak-47, and they showed this lack in Vietnam. Technology wise the USSR was ahead, the space race proves that (the US still has not been on the moon, every first is in Soviet hands). 1965–1975 Economy: USA Military power: USSR Industrial power: USSR and USA about equal. Quality of life: USSR Technology: USA Kruschev is replaced by Breznev, who still keeps the economy growing well until 1975, although the GDP doesn’t grow as well as it used to be under Kruschev. Military power is still in USSR’s favour, the F-15 and 16 still aren’t in service, and the Soviets surpassed the US in terms of total warheads (although the USSR already by the late 50s could obliterate the US, so having some warheads more or less doesn’t change much). The quality of life in the USSR is still better than the USA for the same reasons as before. Technologically wise the US catched up with the USSR in rocketry and got a big advantage in computers. 1975–1985 Economy: USA Military power: USSR Industrial power: USA Technology: USA Life Quality USA. in this period there’s Breznev economic stagnation and corruption begins o be an extreme problem in the USSR. Military wise sheer numbers and still the ability to compete the US in quality puts the USSR still ahead (altough Nato was probably stronger than the WP). The US launches the F16 and the F-15 in the mid/late 70s, while the USSR’s launches comparable fighters (that are maybe a little bit better) in the early 80s (Mig29A and Su27), and this strats to be a considerable gap. Technologically wise USA no doubt, they have an edge so big in computers, even tough the USSR was rapidly catching up. Life quality: USA no doubt, the Soviet people began to see some little lack of goods and computers and color TVs makes US people’s life better. The fact that the Soviets has a better healthcare and public transport does not compensate this. after 1985 there’s no point in doing comparisons, Gorby reforms and corruption killed the USSR

Stronger in what way? Where? The USSR was never stronger economically or in terms of military alliance structure. The government of the USA was always more stable, more just and more durable. The USSR lasted less than 85 years; the USA has been having free elections under the United States Constitution for over 225 years. In terms of America’s true strength, the United States Constitution, the USA was far stronger than the USSR for every day of the USSR’s existence.
